content: Great article and dialogue thus far. However, it seems to me it is leaving out discussion of one of the most important (especially to our students) additions that modern technologies has brought to the subject = interactive mapping. Our students must be acquiring skills sets today that will help them to use maps and data generated from them to improve their lives — whether it is identifying the coordinates of potholes or broken street lights in our streets, or areas of community blight that can be provided to our government leaders as they plan for redevelopment, mapping skills are becoming more and more important in our lives.
